questions.question_text:
Your network contains an Active Directory domain. The domain contains 1,000 computers that run Windows 10.

You configure Microsoft Edge settings by using domain and local Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

You need to generate a report that contains all the Microsoft Edge policy settings applied to a computer.

What should you do?

choices.D: From the Start menu, select Group Policy Object Editor.
choices.B: From a command prompt, run scanstate and specify the /genconfig parameter.

discussion.content: C. From Microsoft Edge, open edge://policy.

questions.answer_description:
The requirement states: Automate the configuration of the contractors' computers. The solution must provide a configuration file that the contractors can open from a Microsoft SharePoint site to apply the required configurations.
The 'configuration file' in this case is known as a 'provisioning package'.
A provisioning package (.ppkg) is a container for a collection of configuration settings. With Windows 10, you can create provisioning packages that let you quickly and efficiently configure a device without having to install a new image.
The tool for creating provisioning packages is renamed Windows Configuration Designer, replacing the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) tool.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/configuration/provisioning-packages/provisioning-install-icd https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/configuration/provisioning-packages/provisioning-packages
questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to implement a solution to configure the contractors' computers.
What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Obviously the answer is making sure that Windows 10 Enterprise app is enabled inside the E3 license. E3 license is composed of many features (Exchange plans, Teams plans etc,), one of them being Windows 10 Enterprise "license"

Selected Answer: D
D;

All the employees are assigned Microsoft 365 E3 licenses.

It says the domain has a user account for user 10

Autopilot reset should do the job
I'm unsure if an E£ licence includes W10 Enterprise? I'm sure you have to add the W10 Enterprise SKU to your tenant in addition to the E3.
AutoPilot should work here since the computers are assigned to Azure AD.

comments.content:
It's even specified that the user is an employee and not a contractor, which means that his device is joined in AAD 

it's actually specified in the case study that the user is an employee 
Overview -
Fabrikam, Inc. is a distribution company that has 500 employees and 100 contractors.

Active Directory -
**
The domain contains a user account for an employee named User10.
True, however, I’m not seeing where it says that that User10 is a contractor.
"All the contractors have their own computer that runs Windows 10. "None of the computers are joined to Azure AD.""

questions.question_text:
You need to ensure that User10 can activate Computer10.
What should you do?

choices.B: From the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), add a Volume License Key to a task sequence, and then redeploy Computer10.
choices.A: Request that a Windows 10 Enterprise license be assigned to User10, and then activate Computer10.
choices.C: From System Properties on Computer10, enter a Volume License Key, and then activate Computer10.
choices.D: Request that User10 perform a local AutoPilot Reset on Computer10, and then activate Computer10.

choices.C: the Update Compliance solution in Azure Log Analytics
choices.B: the Update Management solution in Azure Automation

questions.question_text:
You need to recommend a solution to monitor update deployments.
What should you include in the recommendation?

discussion.content:
If Update Compliance is deprecated and replaced by Windows Update For Business Reports it would work for employees but not for contractors because they are not joined to AZ AD.
Any other solution?

comments.content: In this case I vote for A

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer seems to be correct
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/update-compliance-monitor
